Professional Food and Beverage Services

This module is designed to allow students to practice their F&B skills in a real environment, as well as to discover and practice buffet banquet service. Moreover, students will be operating classes with an a la carte menu giving them an opportunity to manage choices. The various classes are planned to function as a commercial restaurant

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Perform ‘gueridon’ techniques in fine dining setting.

+  Apply upselling setting for order taking with a la carte menu.

+  Perform Mise en place and Service in brigade, following fine dining standard

+  Plan & organize Food production and service for buffet and banquet

+  Control the application of standardized procedures and rules applied in F&B (Hygiene, etc)

+  Conduct a critical analysis of service/food quality and area of improvement.

+  Explain the different setup for F&B provision during MICE event.
